answers.answer: I didn't have high blood pressure til closer to the end. I passed my glucose test at 28 weeks and after that it started getting high. I had to pee in a jug for 24 hours so they could test that. Put I passed. Then when I went in labor my bp was crazy! I had a very poor diet though. Lots of sugar... And I mean lots. Do you have a decent diet?
Honestly no. I drink water and all but I eat sweets like crazy :/ I thought blood pressure was based more on salty foods
Unfortunately it didn't hit me till my 38 week check. Now I have to have routine bp and urine checks till I deliver. I don't actually have pre eclampsia, just threatened
High blood pressure wouldn't help if you are stressing about it too. Try and do some deep breathing to relax yourself.

I had hypertension an preeclampsia with my first. They just watch you more often. I was in an out of hospital a lot til bp was acceptable. I was induced 37w2d with him and he's 2 1/2 now, normal as can be. Afraid its all gonna repeat this time around too. :(

question: Has anyone else had this going on? Im only.18 weeks and scared to be diagnosed with preeclampsia or something. Has this happened to anyone?
title: High blood pressure & pregnant
